definition: to keep the body of the deceased (until burial or cremation)

sentences.english: A man throws a corpse onto a pile of dead bodies, at the morgue of a hospital in Port-au-Prince.
sentences.chinese: 在太子港一座醫院的停屍處，一名男子拋下一具遺體。

sentences.english: They only sign the death certificate and phone the mortuary.
sentences.chinese: 他們會簽署死亡證明書，然後通知停屍間。

sentences.english: I think I left my riding crop in the mortuary.
sentences.chinese: 我想我是把鞭子忘在停屍房了。

sentences.english: Are we in intensive care or the morgue ?
sentences.chinese: 出版業目前在深切治療中還是已經陳屍停屍間呢？

sentences.english: In the mortuary there are many stiffened corpses.
sentences.chinese: 停屍房中擺滿了僵冷的屍體。

sentences.english: He went to the morgue and examined the body.
sentences.chinese: 他停屍房，並檢查了身體。
停屍房後來又重新開門了。

sentences.english: In the morgue, most of the killed appeared to be children.
sentences.chinese: 在停屍點，大部分死亡者幾乎都是孩子。

sentences.english: I found him in the morgue.
It seems odd today, but there was nothing unusual about a school mortuary then.
sentences.chinese: 今天看起來很怪異，但是學校停屍房卻未見什麼異常。
